items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Sunday afternoon. High water at Exmouth is at 5:45pm, times of high water will vary along the coast.
Strong force 8 south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of over 3m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Expect tides to be around 550mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Exmouth is 2.04 mAOD, this is 0.55 metres above astronomical tide level.

items.description: Climping Seafront
items.message: Monday morning's tide at 11:00 on 30/09/2024 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with strong Westerly Force 7 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.34 m. The total forecast tide is 5.73 metres Chart Datum (2.68 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, minimal flood impacts are expected. A small amount of water could find its way behind the beach and may pond on nearby land and fields, including at Climping Street Car Park and Mill Lane. Monday evening's tide at 23:15 on 30/09/2024 is forecast to be 35 cm lower (2.33 mAOD). Minor flood impacts are predicted again but should reduce from Wednesday (02/10/2024). We continue to monitor the forecast and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. We will update this message by 19:00 on 30/09/2024.

items.description: Cuckmere River
items.message: Rain is forecast between 17:00 29/09/2024 and 09:00 30/09/2024. If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 06:00 30/09/2024, flooding could affect fields, rural roads and gardens. If more rain occurs than predicted, water could approach properties on Mill Lane Hellingly, and Grove Hill near Grovebridge Farm. From 11:00 30/09/2024, flood impacts could also affect Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road Hellingly. From 18:00 30/09/2024, flooding could also affect North Street, Willows Car Park, River Lane, The Old Clergy House and Deans Place Hotel, Alfriston. After the rain clears on Monday morning, only isolated showers are forecast for the rest of the week. The river should begin to fall by 14:00 30/09/2024 in Hellingly, and 05:00 01/10/2024 in Alfriston, returning to normal by Wednesday. River levels could end up similar to the past week. Plan to avoid routes vulnerable to flooding, including Mill Lane and Church Road Hellingly and North Street Alfriston. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 30/09/2024

items.description: Combe Haven
items.message: Rain is forecast between 17:00 on 29/09/2024 and 09:00 on 30/09/2024. There remains uncertainty in the amounts, but if as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 05:00 on 30/09/2024, flooding could affect fields, rural roads and gardens of a small number of properties in Crowhurst, including on Forewood Lane and between the Plough public house and the junction of Sampsons Lane on Sandrock Hill. A small amount of water may also affect Bexhill Road Recreation Ground in Bulverhythe. After the rain clears on Monday morning, only isolated showers are forecast for the rest of the week. The river should begin to fall in Crowhurst by 14:00 on 30/09/2024, and return to normal by Tuesday morning. In Bulverhythe river levels will fall slower, and could remain higher than normal all week. River levels could end up similar to the past week, possibly higher if more rain occurs than predicted. Flood protection products are recommended to be installed in Crowhurst, if you have them. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 30/09/2024

items.description: Upper Bristol Avon area
items.message:
River levels are now stable on the upper Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon and Dauntsey Brook but are forecast to begin to rise later today and continue overnight and into tomorrow. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible through Sunday and into Monday.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon and Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.

Flooding is possible today, as river levels are stable but remain higher than usual. Heavy rain is forecast for today and overnight and levels will rise sharply in response. Some property flooding is possible, we are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further Flood Alerts or Warnings as necessary.

Please monitor local water levels and weather conditions and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 2:00 PM on 30/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
River levels on the Bristol Avon at Bradford on Avon and Semington Brook are now stable or falling but are forecast to rise again later today and continue to do so overnight and tomorrow. Flooding may be affecting locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Some property flooding is possible.

Heavy rainfall is forecast later today and overnight and levels are likely to rise again in response. Flooding is possible today as river levels remain high and will rise later in the day. 

We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further Flood Alerts or Warnings as necessary. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Please refer to local authority website for road closures.

This message will be updated by 2:00 PM on 30/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

South Devon coast from Dawlish Warren to Seaton
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Sunday afternoon. High water at Exmouth is at 5:45pm, times of high water will vary along the coast.
Strong force 8 south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of over 3m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Expect tides to be around 550mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Exmouth is 2.04 mAOD, this is 0.55 metres above astronomical tide level.

items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely from now, 9am on Sunday 29th September, and for at least the next 24 hours. Water levels in the Broads are beginning to fall, but remain high. Further rainfall over the next couple of days is likely to increase levels. The forecast high tide at Great Yarmouth will restrict the Broads river system from draining out to sea. Combined with recent rainfall, this is resulting in higher than normal water levels within the Broads. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards, and Ferry Road in Horning. We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Monday 30th September, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Eastern Yar
items.message: The water level in the Eastern Yar is higher than normal. In the last 5 days more than a months rain (72mm) has been recorded at Wroxall. Until 12:00 today (Saturday 28/09/2024), at Sandown, minor impact flooding could affect Golf Links and Moreton Common Road. Property flooding is not expected. Today (Saturday 28/09/2024), the weather will remain dry, and water levels will lower at Sandown by early afternoon. On Sunday (29/09/2024) and Monday (30/09/2024), further heavy rain is forecast with up to 40mm expected. If this volume of rain does affect the river, then there will be much more widespread impacts to low lying land, footpaths, cycle tracks and roads in both the upper and lower river. We have checked that the Bembridge sluice is operating normally. We continue to monitor the forecast and will ensure the river remains free of any reported blockages. Please ensure that any products used to protect gardens or property from flooding can operate if required over the next 2 to 3 days. This Flood Alert will be updated by 10:00 on Monday 30/09/2024.

items.description: River Adur East Branch
items.message: Rain is forecast between 17:00 on 29/09/2024 and 09:00 on 30/09/2024. There remains uncertainty in the amounts, but if as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 10:00 on 30/09/2024, water will be in fields and flooding could also affect gardens of properties near Mock Bridge. If more rain occurs than predicted, then flooding could affect the A281 at Mock Bridge, near Shermanbury, and may begin to approach buildings too. After the rain clears on Monday morning (30/09/2024), only isolated showers are forecast for the rest of the week. The river should begin to fall by 23:00 on 30/09/2024, and should return to normal from Tuesday afternoon (01/10/2024). River levels could end up similar to the past week, possibly higher if more rain occurs than predicted. Some roads, including the A281 at Mock Bridge, may be affected by flooding. Please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 on 30/09/2024.

items.description: River Thame at Dorchester
items.message:
Property flooding is possible.
River levels are high on the River Thame following heavy rainfall earlier in the week. Therefore flooding of properties, low-lying land, and roads is expected to continue today, 29/09/2024. Areas most at risk are properties closest to the river where it passes through Dorchester.
The forecast is for a dry morning, with rain expected later today and overnight. River levels are dropping, but are sensitive to further rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Avoid contact with flood water. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated on Sunday evening (29/09/2024), or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Uck
items.message: Rain is forecast between 17:00 on 29/09/2024 and 09:00 on 30/09/2024. There remains uncertainty in the amounts, but if as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 07:00 on 30/09/2024, flooding could affect fields, rural roads, and gardens. If more rain occurs than predicted, water could approach riverside properties through Buxted, near the White Hart pub, and areas around Hempstead Mill on Hempstead Lane, and Mill Lane, Uckfield. From 11:00 on 30/09/2024, flood water could affect gardens at Isfield Mill and Isfield Bridge. After the rain clears on Monday morning, only isolated showers are forecast for the rest of the week. The river should begin to fall by 14:00 on 30/09/2024 in Buxted and 20:00 on 30/09/2024 in Isfield, returning to normal by Tuesday afternoon. River levels could end up similar to the past week, possibly higher if more rain occurs than predicted. Flood protection products are recommended to be installed in Buxted and Isfield, if you have them. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 on 30/09/2024
